title: Ticket #2588: User log gives unhelpful exception reason for permissions problems
description:
1. On Linux... 2. Create an executable that creates a new file with unusual permissions. (The unusual permissions part is probably optional) 3. Submit the executable as a job using file transfer. The submit directory should be on a Samba mount with permissions mashed to 777. 4. Observe that the job encounters a stream of shadow exceptions and eventually fails. 5. Observe that the ShadowLog contains a pretty clear error: (anonymized) 
10/26/11 11:18:43 (3198015.0) (1306): ReliSock::get_file_with_permissions(): Failed to chmod file '/mnt/smb/outfile': Operation not permitted (errno: 1)
10/26/11 11:18:43 (3198015.0) (1306): DoDownload: SHADOW at XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX failed to receive file /mnt/smb/outfile
10/26/11 11:18:43 (3198015.0) (1306): Can no longer talk to condor_starter <XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX:33379>

Expected behavior: the job log gives an error something like "ReliSock::get_file_with_permissions(): Failed to chmod file '/mnt/smb/outfile': Operation not permitted (errno: 1)"

Actual behavior: 

022 (3198056.000.000) 10/26 11:04:11 Job disconnected, attempting to reconnect
    Socket between submit and execute hosts closed unexpectedly
    Trying to reconnect to slot5@example.com <XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX:33695>

Reporting an unexpected disconnect is not helpful to the user and fails to identify the real problem (an inability to chmod a file). It's downright misleading, as the connection was not unexpectedly closed, we closed it with intent.
